channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for RI

item.title: Report X-2023090184
item.description:
Report X-2023090184

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: WARWICK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO DOOR FOR HAZMAT LEAKER AND RESPONDED. RESPONDER LOCATED LEAKER ON THE GRATING DRIPPING ONTO FLOOR. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE TO CLEAN LEAKER AND TRANSPORT BACK TO DMP TO PROCESS.

item.title: Report I-2023090088
item.description:
Report I-2023090088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Event occurred onboard UA2274 ORD-EWR on 28AUG2023 1. FA Patrik Repka(u399744) noticed an unusual smell after the inflight service 2. He quickly realized the smell was coming from his personal disposable vape in his pocket 3. The vape was hot to the touch though no flames were present 4. FA believes there may have been light"vape" smoke as the device appeared to have been running 5. FAs notified the flight deck and obtained the TCB 6. FAs placed overheating vape inside the TCB and stowed TCB in aft galley cart 7. After customers deplaned in EWR, FAs handed off TCB with vape inside to the CSR 8. FA Repka stated the device was a Lava brand disposable vape
